DataElement.preferredName: Substance Extraction Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Study Day Range ISO21090.IVL.INT.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of extracting something from an associated study subject for the purpose of the extracted product to be administered to a study subject. EXAMPLE(S): A donor giving Bone Marrow Stem Cells for a Stem Cell Transplant NOTE(S): The study subject could be the same for the extraction and the intended administration. This is different than a performed specimen collection, in that the intent is different: This is a donation. The relative timing for a performed activity expressed as the number of days offset from the study-defined reference activity (e.g., date of registration, start of treatment) for this particular experimental unit. EXAMPLE(S): Day 1, Days 10-20 OTHER NAME(S): Study Day NOTE(S): The study-defined reference activity can be different from study to study. The study day for a date after this reference activity is a positive integer calculated as the difference in the two dates + 1. The study day for dates before the reference activity is a negative integer calculated as the difference between the two dates. Note that this means there is no "Day 0."

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Extraction Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Study Day Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.:The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._The relative timing for a planned or performed activity expressed as the number of days offset from the study-defined reference activity (e.g., date of registration, start of treatment) for this particular experimental unit.  EXAMPLE(S): Day 1, Days 10-20  OTHER NAME(S): Study Day  NOTE(S): The study-defined reference activity can be different from study to study. The study day for a date after this reference activity is a positive integer calculated as the difference in the two dates + 1.  The study day for dates before the reference activity is a negative integer calculated as the difference between the two dates.  Note that this means there is no "Day 0."

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Extraction Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.:The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The relative timing for a planned or performed activity expressed as the number of days offset from the study-defined reference activity (e.g., date of registration, start of treatment) for this particular experimental unit.  EXAMPLE(S): Day 1, Days 10-20  OTHER NAME(S): Study Day  NOTE(S): The study-defined reference activity can be different from study to study. The study day for a date after this reference activity is a positive integer calculated as the difference in the two dates + 1.  The study day for dates before the reference activity is a negative integer calculated as the difference between the two dates.  Note that this means there is no "Day 0."

EXAMPLE(S): Day 1, Days 10-20 OTHER NAME(S): Study Day NOTE(S): The study-defined reference activity can be different from study to study. The study day for a date after this reference activity is a positive integer calculated as the difference in the two dates + 1.  The study day for dates before the reference activity is a negative integer calculated as the difference between the two dates.  Note that this means there is no "Day 0."

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Set of consecutive values of an ordered base datatype of the type INT.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
